property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Discussing humanitarian aid with an Afghan official

note.text: Corruption is fairly common in Afghanistan. For example, Afghans may take advantage of personnel turnovers by duplicating aid requests. In addition, they may give preference to their own family members when hiring contractors. However, Afghans may not view such practices as corrupt. They may view them instead as a way of honoring relationships.
To avoid the effects of corruption, keep records of everything you do and coordinate with outgoing and incoming U.S. teams.
